abstract: The chief executive has sought to make the bank simpler and smaller. The question now is how many more strings he has left to pull.
snippet: The chief executive has sought to make the bank simpler and smaller. The question now is how many more strings he has left to pull.
lead_paragraph: HSBC is digging in for a low-interest-rate world. Economic malaise in the West has depressed demand for loans. Central bank money printing is weighing on the lender’s large deposit base. With no pickup in sight, HSBC’s returns depend on its ability to keep cutting costs.
